title: HarryHuang
research_interests: Applying AI to legal texts through NLP, RAG, and knowledge modeling, enhancing legal information accessibility.
short_bio: I am a Mathematics graduate from National Cheng Kung University with a strong focus on applying AI to legal text analysis. My research combines NLP, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and hierarchical knowledge modeling to enhance entity extraction, constitutional issue identification, and legal knowledge graph construction

title: Master’s student
research_interests: AI ethics and the integration of diverse artificial intelligence technologies
short_bio: Mu-Ko Chou is a master's student in the Intelligent Technology Systems Program at the Miin Wu School of Computing, National Cheng Kung University (NCKU), with a background in political science. Her research focuses on AI ethics and the integration of diverse artificial intelligence technologies, particularly in: (1) legal AI applications; (2) incorporating cultural dimensions into LLMs to examine cross-cultural differences in simulated human decision-making; and (3) designing domain-specific LLM benchmarks with stakeholder participation to ensure local relevance, fairness, and practical value.

title: Multidisciplinary Humanities Explorer
short_bio: I am a senior undergraduate in History at NCKU, focusing on Digital Humanities. My interests include applying AI, especially language models and retrieval techniques, to expand research possibilities.
